frontMatter.title: Forms overview
frontMatter.description: Templates and patterns for creating accessible, Veteran-centered forms on VA.gov.
frontMatter.intro: This section provides guidance for building benefit applications, multi-step processes, and data collection experiences that serve Veterans and their families.

when_to_use.value: **Benefit applications.** Forms suited for benefit applications requiring personal information collection.
**Multi-step processes.** Processes requiring progress-saving and validation.
**Data collection.** Experiences needing validation and error handling.
**Authenticated experiences.** Where users review and update their information.

structure.intro: The complete form journey consists of five key pages that guide users from discovery to confirmation.

sections.title: How to Apply
sections.description: Drupal landing page outlining eligibility and application details.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.description: Sets expectations and provides preparation steps before starting the form.

sections.title: Step Pages
sections.description: Core information collection following established patterns.

sections.title: Review
sections.description: Allows users to verify and edit their responses before submission.

sections.title: Confirmation
sections.description: Explains next steps after successful submission.

content_guidelines.value: **One thing per page.** Reduce cognitive load by focusing on single tasks.
**Progressive disclosure.** Show only necessary content at each step.
**Clear progress indicators.** Help users understand where they are in the process.
**Automatic progress-saving.** Preserve user work for authenticated sessions.
**Plain language.** Use clear, simple communication throughout.

accessibility.value: Follow VA.gov form accessibility guidelines for all form implementations.
Use the VA Forms Library for standardized, accessible functionality.
Refer to the Content style guide for appropriate language.
See the Guide to Digitizing VA Forms for comprehensive project planning.
